greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime p such that 2*prime(n) - p^2 is semiprime, or a(n)=0 if there is no such p.
link: Peter J. C. Moses, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: Let n=16, then 2*prime(16) = 2*53 = 106. We have 106-4=102, 106-9=97, 106-25=81, 106-49=57, and only the last number is semiprime. So a(16)=7.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {for (i=1, n, if ((v = 2*prime(n) - prime(i)^2) <= 0, break;); if (bigomega(v) == 2, return (prime(i))););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 09 2014
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 25 2014
